actor_awards.notes: Born in Australia, she became a Dame Commander of the British Empire (DBE) in 1960. She is best known for her chilling portrayal of Mrs. Danvers in Hitchcock's Rebecca. She won two Emmy Awards for her television performances as Lady Macbeth and Queen Elizabeth I.

filmography.title: Rebecca
filmography.role_description: The sinister and obsessive housekeeper who torments the new Mrs. de Winter with the memory of her predecessor.
filmography.plot: A self-conscious woman juggles adjusting to her new role as an aristocrat's wife and avoiding being intimidated by his first wife's spectral presence.

filmography.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
filmography.role_description: The loud, boisterous, and distressed matriarch of a Southern family dealing with greed, lies, and impending death.
filmography.plot: Brick, an alcoholic ex-football player, drinks his days away and resists the affections of his wife, Maggie. His reunion with his father, Big Daddy, who is dying of cancer, jogs a host of memories and revelations for both father and son.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Laura
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, cynical socialite who is the aunt of the murder victim and has her own secrets.
filmography.plot: A police detective falls in love with the woman whose murder he is investigating.

filmography.title: The Ten Commandments
filmography.role_description: The loyal servant who keeps the secret of Moses' Hebrew birth until she is goaded into revealing it.
filmography.plot: Moses, raised as a prince of Egypt in the Pharaoh's household, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.

filmography.title: And Then There Were None
filmography.role_description: A self-righteous and judgmental spinster who is one of ten strangers invited to an island where they are killed off one by one.
filmography.plot: Seven guests, a newly hired personal secretary, and two staff are gathered for a weekend on an isolated island by an unknown host, who accuses each of them of murder.
filmography.awards: Locarno International Film Festival: Win – Best Film

filmography.title: King's Row
filmography.role_description: The cruel and controlling wife of the town doctor who keeps her daughter isolated from the world.
filmography.plot: The story of a small American town at the turn of the century, where secrets, madness, and tragedy lurk beneath the surface.

filmography.title: A Man Called Horse
filmography.role_description: The elderly mother of the Sioux chief who adopts the captured English aristocrat as her son.
filmography.plot: An English aristocrat is captured by a Native American tribe and given to the chief's mother as a servant. Gradually, he embraces their way of life and falls in love.
filmography.awards: Western Heritage Awards: Win – Bronze Wrangler

filmography.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
filmography.role_description: The dignified Vulcan leader who performs the fal-tor-pan ritual to reunite Spock's katra with his body.
filmography.plot: Admiral Kirk and his bridge crew risk their careers stealing the decommissioned Enterprise to return to the restricted Genesis Planet to recover Spock's body.

filmography.title: The Furies
filmography.role_description: The gold-digging girlfriend of a cattle baron, whose face is disfigured by his vengeful daughter.
filmography.plot: A headstrong daughter clashes with her cattle baron father over the ownership of their ranch, The Furies.

filmography.title: Pursued
filmography.role_description: The adoptive mother of the protagonist, who holds the secrets to his traumatic past.
filmography.plot: A man plagued by nightmares and a hidden past is hunted by a mysterious figure in this psychological western.

filmography.title: Salome
filmography.role_description: The scheming queen who manipulates her daughter Salome and plots against John the Baptist.
filmography.plot: After being banished from Rome, Princess Salome returns to Galilee where she meets John the Baptist and King Herod.

filmography.title: The Red House
filmography.role_description: The sister of a farmer who helps him keep the dark secret of the Red House hidden.
filmography.plot: An old man and his sister conceal a terrible secret from their adopted daughter, regarding an abandoned farmhouse in the woods.

filmography.title: Cinderfella
filmography.role_description: The cruel stepmother who exploits her stepson in this Jerry Lewis comedy adaptation of Cinderella.
filmography.plot: When his father dies, a young man is left at the mercy of his snobbish stepmother and her two sons.

filmography.title: Lady Scarface
filmography.role_description: A ruthless female gangster known as 'Slade' who leads a criminal gang.
filmography.plot: A female gangster with a scar on her face leads a gang of robbers while eluding the police.

filmography.title: Macbeth
filmography.role_description: The ambitious wife of Macbeth who urges him to commit regicide. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A prophecy from three witches drives a Scottish lord to murder his King and take the throne for himself.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Win – Outstanding Single Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role

filmography.title: All Through the Night
filmography.role_description: A Nazi spy posing as a dressmaker.
filmography.plot: Gangsters track down a fifth-columnist ring after the baker of their favorite cheesecake is murdered.

filmography.title: Edge of Darkness
filmography.role_description: A leader in the Norwegian resistance movement against Nazi occupation.
filmography.plot: After two years of German occupation, the people of a Norwegian fishing village rise up against the Nazis.

filmography.title: The Strange Love of Martha Ivers
filmography.role_description: The wealthy, domineering aunt whose murder sets the plot in motion.
filmography.plot: Years after a murder, the wealthy heiress Martha Ivers is dominated by her husband, until a childhood friend returns to town.

filmography.title: Tycoon
filmography.role_description: The companion to the love interest of John Wayne's character.
filmography.plot: An American engineer builds a railroad tunnel through the Andes for a powerful tycoon, courting his daughter in the process.

filmography.title: The Diary of a Chambermaid
filmography.role_description: The strict and repressive mistress of the household where the chambermaid works.
filmography.plot: A chambermaid uses her beauty and wit to advance her station in 19th-century France.

filmography.title: Elizabeth the Queen
filmography.role_description: A powerful portrayal of the aging Queen in this television adaptation of Maxwell Anderson's play. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: The story of the romance between Queen Elizabeth I and Robert Devereux, Earl of Essex.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Win – Outstanding Single Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role in a Drama

filmography.title: Specter of the Rose
filmography.role_description: An eccentric ballet teacher who helps a young dancer.
filmography.plot: A ballet dancer is suspected of murdering his first wife, but a young ballerina falls in love with him anyway.

filmography.title: Blood Money
filmography.role_description: The nightclub hostess and lover of a bail bondsman. Anderson's film debut.
filmography.plot: A bail bondsman gets involved with a wealthy thrill-seeker and the criminal underworld.

filmography.title: Inn of the Damned
filmography.role_description: The vengeful owner of an inn in the Australian outback where guests mysteriously disappear.
filmography.plot: Travelers at a remote inn in the Australian bush are being murdered by the insane owners.

filmography.title: Medea
filmography.role_description: The title role in the Euripides tragedy, portraying a woman scorned who seeks terrible revenge. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Medea seeks revenge against her husband Jason who has betrayed her for another woman.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Best Single Performance by an Actress
